verses.verse: "Do you know <S%H3045><s%> the time <S%H6256><s%> when the mountain <S%H5553><s%> goats <S%H3277><s%> give birth? <S%H3205><s%> Do you watch <S%H8104><s%> when the doe <S%H355><s%> bears fawns? <S%H2342><s%>
Can you number <S%H5608><s%> the months <S%H3391><s%> that they fulfill? <S%H4390><s%> Or do <S%H4390><s%> you know <S%H3045><s%> the time when they give birth? <S%H6256><s%>
They bow <S%H3766><s%> themselves, <S%H6398><s%> they bring forth their young, <S%H3206><s%> they end <S%H7971><s%> their labor pains. <S%H2256><s%>
Their young ones <S%H1121><s%> become strong. <S%H2492><s%> They grow up <S%H7235><s%> in the open field. <S%H1250><s%> They go forth, <S%H3318><s%> and don't <S%H7725><s%> return again.
"Who has set <S%H7971><s%> the wild donkey <S%H6501><s%> free? <S%H2670><s%> Or who has loosened <S%H6605><s%> the bonds <S%H4147><s%> of the swift donkey, <S%H6171><s%>
Whose home <S%H1004><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> the wilderness, <S%H6160><s%> and the salt <S%H4420><s%> land his dwelling place? <S%H4908><s%>
He scorns <S%H7832><s%> the tumult <S%H1995><s%> of the city, <S%H7151><s%> neither does he hear <S%H8085><s%> the shouting <S%H8663><s%> of the driver. <S%H5065><s%>
The range <S%H3491><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> is his pasture, <S%H4829><s%> He searches <S%H1875><s%> after <S%H310><s%> every green thing. <S%H3387><s%>
"Will the wild ox <S%H7214><s%> be content <S%H14><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> you? <S%H3885><s%> Or will he stay by your feeding trough? <S%H18><s%>
Can you hold <S%H7194><s%> the wild ox <S%H7214><s%> in the furrow <S%H8525><s%> with his harness? <S%H5688><s%> Or will he till <S%H7702><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> after you? <S%H310><s%>
Will you trust <S%H982><s%> him, <S%H3581><s%> because his strength is great? <S%H7227><s%> Or will you leave <S%H5800><s%> to him your labor? <S%H3018><s%>
Will you confide <S%H539><s%> in him, <S%H7725><s%> that he will bring home your seed, <S%H2233><s%> and gather <S%H622><s%> the grain of your threshing floor? <S%H1637><s%>
"The wings <S%H3671><s%> of the ostrich <S%H5965><s%> wave proudly; <S%H7443><s%> but are they the feathers <S%H84><s%> and plumage <S%H2624><s%> of love? <S%H5133><s%>
For she leaves <S%H5800><s%> her eggs <S%H1000><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> warms <S%H2552><s%> them in the dust, <S%H6083><s%>
and forgets <S%H7911><s%> that the foot <S%H7272><s%> may crush <S%H2115><s%> them, <S%H7704><s%> or that the wild animal <S%H2416><s%> may trample them. <S%H1758><s%>
She deals harshly <S%H7188><s%> with her young ones, <S%H1121><s%> as if they were not <S%H3808><s%> hers. <S%H3018><s%> Though her labor is in vain, <S%H7385><s%> she is without fear, <S%H6343><s%>
because God <S%H433><s%> has deprived <S%H5382><s%> her of wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> neither has he imparted <S%H2505><s%> to her understanding. <S%H998><s%>
When <S%H6256><s%> she lifts up <S%H4754><s%> herself on high, <S%H4791><s%> she scorns <S%H7832><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider. <S%H7392><s%>
"Have you given <S%H5414><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> might? <S%H1369><s%> Have you clothed <S%H3847><s%> his neck <S%H6677><s%> with a quivering mane? <S%H7483><s%>
Have you made him to leap <S%H7493><s%> as a locust? <S%H697><s%> The glory <S%H1935><s%> of his snorting <S%H5170><s%> is awesome. <S%H367><s%>
He paws <S%H2658><s%> in the valley, <S%H6010><s%> and rejoices <S%H7797><s%> in his strength. <S%H3581><s%> He goes out <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> the armed men. <S%H5402><s%>
He mocks <S%H7832><s%> at fear, <S%H6343><s%> and is not dismayed, <S%H2865><s%> neither does he turn back <S%H7725><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the sword. <S%H2719><s%>
The quiver <S%H827><s%> rattles <S%H7439><s%> against him, <S%H3851><s%> the flashing spear <S%H2595><s%> and the javelin. <S%H3591><s%>

He eats <S%H1572><s%> up the ground <S%H776><s%> with fierceness <S%H7494><s%> and rage, <S%H7267><s%> neither does he stand still <S%H539><s%> at the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet. <S%H7782><s%>

As often as the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> sounds <S%H1767><s%> he snorts, <S%H559><s%> <S%H1889><s%> 'Aha!' <S%H1889><s%> He smells <S%H7306><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> afar off, <S%H7350><s%> the thunder <S%H7482><s%> of the captains, <S%H8269><s%> and the shouting. <S%H8643><s%>
"Is it by your wisdom <S%H998><s%> that the hawk <S%H5322><s%> soars, <S%H82><s%> and stretches <S%H6566><s%> her wings <S%H3671><s%> toward the south? <S%H8486><s%>
Is it at your command <S%H6310><s%> that the eagle <S%H5404><s%> mounts up, <S%H1361><s%> and makes <S%H7311><s%> his nest <S%H7064><s%> on high? <S%H7311><s%>
On the cliff <S%H5553><s%> he dwells, <S%H7931><s%> and makes his home, <S%H3885><s%> on the point <S%H5553><s%> of the cliff, <S%H8127><s%> and the stronghold. <S%H4686><s%>
From there he spies <S%H2658><s%> out the prey. <S%H400><s%> His eyes <S%H5869><s%> see <S%H5027><s%> it afar off. <S%H7350><s%>
His young ones <S%H667><s%> also suck up <S%H5966><s%> blood. <S%H1818><s%> Where the slain <S%H2491><s%> are, <S%H1931><s%> there he is."
